com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.lookup.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.settings.SettingsStore, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.Named, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Transceiver, ZookeeperChangeListener, Iterable<Object>
public class ZookeeperSettingsStore extends com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.settings.BaseSettingsStore implements ZookeeperChangeListener
A SettingsStore that uses Apache Zookeeper to load and save settings objects so they can be easily accessed in a clustered environment.

Creating a Zookeeper Settings Store

A ZookeeperSettingsStore can be constructed with or without an explicit Zookeeper CreateMode. The connection to Zookeeper is maintained by a ZookeeperConnection that is configured with ZookeeperConnection.Settings. If no explicit create mode is specified for the store, the default create mode specified by ZookeeperConnection.Settings will be used.

Configuration

When using the kivakit -deployment switch, the ZookeeperConnection.properties file in the deployments package next to your application should look similar to this (but will vary depending on your Zookeeper installation): 

 class   = com.telenav.kivakit.settings.stores.zookeeper.ZookeeperConnection$Settings

 ports   = 127.0.0.1:2181,127.0.0.1:2182
 timeout = 60s
 create-mode = PERSISTENT

The comma-separated list of ports (host and port number) is used by the Zookeeper client when connecting to the cluster.

Loading Settings

ZookeeperSettingsStore extends BaseSettingsStore, which implements SettingsStore. So, it can be used in the same way as other KivaKit settings stores. The settings for an application can be loaded from the Zookeeper settings store with this line of code: 

    registerSettingsIn(listenTo(new ZookeeperSettingsStore()));

Initializing Settings

If the desired settings are not available when the ZookeeperSettingsStore has been loaded, it may be necessary to save some initial settings (it is also possible to store the JSON in Zookeeper directly). Settings can be saved to ZookeeperSettingsStore using the BaseSettingsStore.save(SettingsObject) method. The code to load-or-initialize settings looks like: 

 // Create the Zookeeper settings store,
 var store = listenTo(register(new ZookeeperSettingsStore()));

 // load settings from the store,
 registerSettingsIn(store);

 // and if our required settings class is absent,
 if (!hasSettings(MySettings.class))
 {
     // save a default object to Zookeeper,
     store.save(new MySettings());

     // and re-load the store.
     registerSettingsIn(store);
 }

Reacting to Changes

Because KivaKit's Registry methods pull objects from the registry, it is generally not necessary to respond to Zookeeper data changes. When a node in Zookeeper that is storing a settings object changes, this settings store will be updated with the new object and changes will be propagated to the global settings registry. The next time the settings object is looked up, the new version will be retrieved.

In less common cases, these methods can be overridden:

  • onSettingsUpdated(StringPath, SettingsObject) - Called when a settings object is created or updated
  • onSettingsDeleted(StringPath, SettingsObject) - Called when a settings object is deleted

jonathanl (shibo)

      public com.telenav.kivakit.configuration.settings.SettingsObject readSettings​(com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.paths.StringPath path)

      2. Indexes the object

      @NotNull public @NotNull com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.paths.StringPath unflatten​(com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.paths.StringPath path)
